data.title: Raspberry Pi CI build error due to problem in setting up the build environment
data.body:
The installation of `libasound2-dev` software package has causing a lot of build error false alarm lately. For whatever reason, it did not happen in the past. The installation of this package is actually redundant for Raspberry-Pi platform because all the prerequisite software packages for Urho3D has in fact already installed in the Raspberry-Pi sysroot image.
- Update .travis.yml to exclude package installation when targetting Raspberry-Pi platform.
- Optionally, recreate Raspberry-Pi sysroot image to upgrade Raspbian OS to the last release in June.

data.title: Android CI package build failed
data.body: There seems to be a problem with the Android build tool component installation in the CI server. The Android build artifacts are not uploaded to SF.net for the past couple of packaging build.

data.title: Connection::SetOrientation(Quaternion& quaternion);
data.body: I want to know orientation  client camera. I found Connection::SetPosition method, but I want know orientation. Add Connection::SetOrientation(Quaternion& quaternion); method please.

data.title: Index at top of script api documentation
data.body: It would be really nice if there was a list at the top of this page http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_script_a_p_i.html that listed each object. I look at this page very often and have been using CTRL+F to find the section for a the object I'm looking for (you can probably guess how painfully slow this can be for objects that are listed a lot in there, like Node for example). So it would be super helpful (and ALOT faster) if I can see a list of each object and click one for it to hop me down to it. Can the documentation generator do this? Thank you! :) I'm loving this engine so far!

data.title: Add documentation map to travis build
data.body: This creates a map of pages in the documentation.

data.title: Network rigidbody glitchness after first disconnect
data.body: Hi. I have a server and client script. Clients can connect (as many as you want) to the server and walk around. But after a client disconnects the next person (and every client after that) to join has some seriously weird physics stuff going on (jittering up and down and sometimes slowly phasing through the ground). Heres a gyazo gif/mp4 http://gyazo.com/94caa1e0461ca0519e7a1ea3e7368c54 of this in action (just the jittering, I recommend watching the MP4 opposed to the GIF as its much smoother). One of the strange things is that once the player moves or rotates the camera the player snaps back to the correct place. This leads me to think that it has something to do with networking? I can post both source files if needed.

data.title: UI Menu cannot hide when click others
data.body: When clicking other ui elements or emptiness, the opened menu cannot hide since either E_UIMOUSECLICK or E_FOCUSCHANGED event has received by this menu which is quite strange in the Editor. However, the menu receives E_UIMOUSECLICKEND event after the clicking. IMHO, E_UIMOUSECLICK and E_UIMOUSECLICKEND should be treated equally and share the same behavior. Should we add a click-others-event or let the menu get the click event?

data.title: Fix index out of range
Sweep Rigidbodies
data.body: It would be useful to have a collision-shape sweep test for arbitrary geometry- i.e. similar to the spherecast but with a specified CollisionShape or bounding box.

data.title: Differentiate between shared library SOVERSION and source code git revision number
data.body:
In the recent commit we have introduced the SOVERSION to our shared library. In the initial attempt the SOVERSION is being derived from git revision number, e.g. 1.31.873. This has two undesired consequences.
1. Apple linker does not like patch number greater than 255 (0xFF). It only accepts 32-bit SOVERSION in this format 0xFFFF.0xFF.0xFF.
2. The SOVERSION is increased unnecessarily on each commit, even when there is no change in the API of the shared library.

data.title: Problems separating Client and Server code
data.body: Hi again, sorry to bother you so much. But I'm trying to separate the server and client code from your 17_SceneReplication.as example. I got it mostly working, but what I don't understand is why the server needs to call the same CreateScene as the client. I understand why the Floor (lines 80-96) would need to be created server-side (because the server handles all the physics movement). But why do I need to create the Camera and stuff? I've tried removing it, but then the scene doesn't get rendered client-side. Which doesn't seem to make sense as its being created with LOCAL (should only affect the server right?)

data.title: Random segmentation fault on Linux (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS)
data.body:
I'm compiling it as a 32 bit program using gcc/g++ and make (generated using cmake_gcc.sh). And for whatever reason, when I run a script (01_HelloWorld.as for example) a segmentation fault occurs.

Here is my terminals output:

[Tue Aug  5 23:53:58 2014] INFO: Opened log file /home/cameron/.local/share/urho3d/logs/01_HelloWorld.as.log
[Tue Aug  5 23:53:58 2014] INFO: Created 3 worker threads
[Tue Aug  5 23:53:58 2014] INFO: Added resource path /home/cameron/Desktop/Urho3D-master/Bin/CoreData/
[Tue Aug  5 23:53:58 2014] INFO: Added resource path /home/cameron/Desktop/Urho3D-master/Bin/Data/
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

Thank you for any help!

(BTW I was able to compile this on Windows 7 using mingw)

data.title: Dump used resource file names when exiting.
CustomGeometry need dynamic update
data.body: Currently, the CustomGeometry is designed to be static. We create it once and recreate it to make changes. I think an efficient, dynamic updating method is strongly needed.

data.title: More Primitives Type needed
data.body: There are only two primitive types there, we need more to have full function. e.g. triangle fan, line strip, etc.

data.title: More Primitive Type needed
data.body: There are only two primitive types there, we need more to have full function. e.g. triangle fan, line strip, etc.

data.title: Update AngelScript (2.29.1)
data.body:
Just a notice that AngelScript has been updated on July 20th.
[Release notes](http://www.angelcode.com/angelscript/changes.php)

data.title: Background loading of resources
data.body:
- Adds a mechanism for background loading resources. Call ResourceCache::BackgroundLoadResource() to use. Resource loading is now split into two virtual functions: BeginLoad(), which can run in a background thread, and EndLoad(), which always runs in the main thread and for example uploads GPU data.
- Scene::LoadAsync() and LoadAsyncXML() have been expanded to support background preloading the scene's resources first, and also a mode where only the resources are loaded, but not the scene content itself. This can be used to preload resources from an object prefab to ensure fast instantiation later.
- Improvements for threading. Log messages are supported from outside main thread, using the Profiler becomes a safe no-op, while sending events & ResourceCache::GetResouce() log errors if attempted from outside the main thread.

data.title: Wrong mouse position when handling UI mouse move
data.body:
When I call input->GetMousePosition() inside UI::ProcessMove, I get the wrong mouse position when the mouse is out of bound of the Editor window.
The reason to get mouse position is that I want to implement a spin LineEdit in which when the cursor going near by the borders it can be set back to the opposite side of the screen just like the spin editor which can be found in 3ds max.

BTW, I'm on Windows 7 x64.

data.title: Fixed AssetImporter to adjust time of first key frame to 0.
Provide a clone operation for Model
data.body: For modifying unique instances of model-based objects, it should be possible to clone a Model resource, to create unique copies of the VertexBuffer, IndexBuffer & Geometry objects held within. After this the model clones can be applied to the objects and modified without affecting the others.
